data.name: Hexagram.1.Statement
data.value: Sublime success, perseverance furthers.

data.name: Hexagram.1.Commentary
data.value: Indeed sublime is the creative power of the Creative. All things owe their beginning to it. It leads through the clouds and brings rain. It completes all species. Brightly shines the Creative from beginning to end. Each of the six stages reaches its proper time. Mounted on six dragons, it governs the heavens. The way of the Creative works through change and transformation, so that each thing receives its true nature and destiny and all is in accord with the Great Harmony. Thus it furthers to persevere. At the head of things, it leads all to their destiny. All nations are at peace.

data.name: Hexagram.1.Image
data.value: The movement of heaven is full of power. Thus the superior man strengthens himself without ceasing.

data.name: Line.1.First.Statement
data.value: Hidden dragon. Do not act.

data.name: Line.1.First.Image
data.value: 'Hidden dragon. Do not act.' – The yang is at the bottom.

data.name: Line.1.Second.Statement
data.value: Dragon appearing in the field. It will be advantageous to meet with the great man.

data.name: Line.1.Second.Image
data.value: 'Dragon appearing in the field' – Virtue is widely spread.

data.name: Line.1.Third.Statement
data.value: The superior man is active and vigilant all the day, and in the evening still careful and apprehensive. (The position is) dangerous, but there will be no mistake.

data.name: Line.1.Third.Image
data.value: 'Active and vigilant all day' – Going back and forth, following the Way.

data.name: Line.1.Fourth.Statement
data.value: (The dragon is) looking as if he were leaping up, but still in the deep. There will be no mistake.

data.name: Line.1.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Looking as if leaping up, still in the deep' – Advancing brings no blame.

data.name: Line.1.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Flying dragon in the heavens. It will be advantageous to meet with the great man.

data.name: Line.1.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Flying dragon in the heavens' – The great man creates.

data.name: Line.1.Sixth.Statement
data.value: The arrogant dragon will have cause to repent.

data.name: Line.1.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Arrogant dragon will have cause to repent' – Fullness cannot last long.

data.name: Line.55.First.Statement
data.value: He meets his complementary ruler. Though they are (both) of the same character, there will be no blame. If he go forward, he will be praised.

data.name: Line.55.First.Image
data.value: 'Though equal for ten days, no blame' – Going beyond ten days brings disaster.

data.name: Line.55.Second.Statement
data.value: He makes his abundance (like) a great tent. At noon he sees the (Great) Dipper (Ursa Major). If he go forward, he will be mistrusted and disliked. Let him show his sincerity, and thereby afford ground for joy. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.55.Second.Image
data.value: 'Covered with a great tent' – He acts as a guest, but gets the master.

data.name: Line.55.Third.Statement
data.value: He makes his abundance (like) a covering flag. At noon he sees the small star. He breaks his right arm. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.55.Third.Image
data.value: 'Covered with a covering flag' – He breaks his right arm, but no blame.

data.name: Line.55.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He makes his abundance (like) a great tent. At noon he sees the (Great) Dipper. He meets with the ruler (who is his) counterpart. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.55.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Meeting with the ruler who is his counterpart' – This is fitting. Great good fortune.

data.name: Line.55.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The (ruler) is represented by the (fifth line, divided and) central. The result is 'brilliance.' There will be cause for congratulation and praise. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.55.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The result is brilliance' – The position is appropriate.

data.name: Line.55.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He makes his house large. He screens his family (from the world). He peeps through his door. It is still, and no one is (seen) there. For three years no one appears. There will be evil.

data.name: Line.55.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He screens his family from the world' – This is a great mistake.

data.name: Line.63.First.Statement
data.value: He drags back his wheel. He wets his tail. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.63.First.Image
data.value: 'He drags back his wheel' – (this cautious attitude is) right, and therefore there is no blame.

data.name: Line.63.Second.Statement
data.value: The woman loses her carriage curtain. Do not pursue it. In seven days you will get it.

data.name: Line.63.Second.Image
data.value: 'In seven days you will get it' – (because she adheres to) the central path (the Mean).

data.name: Line.63.Third.Statement
data.value: The Gao Zong (Emperor Wu Ding of Yin) attacked the Gui Fang region. After three years he conquered them. Small men should not be employed (in such tasks).

data.name: Line.63.Third.Image
data.value: 'After three years he conquered them' – (the state is) wearied.

data.name: Line.63.Fourth.Statement
data.value: There are rags (needed) for padding leaks in the boat. Be on guard all day long.

data.name: Line.63.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Be on guard all day long' – (because there is) something to be feared (suspicion of danger).

data.name: Line.63.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The neighbor in the east who slaughters an ox (for sacrifice) does not equal the neighbor in the west with his simple offering, who truly receives the blessing.

data.name: Line.63.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The neighbor in the east who slaughters an ox is not equal to the neighbor in the west' – (because the latter's offering is) timely. 'He truly receives the blessing' – for great good fortune comes (to him).

data.name: Line.63.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He gets his head immersed (in the water). There is peril.

data.name: Line.63.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He gets his head immersed. There is peril.' – How can this last long?

data.name: Line.19.First.Statement
data.value: Approaching with widespread influence (or: through feeling). Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.19.First.Image
data.value: 'Approaching with influence. Perseverance brings good fortune.' – For the will is carried out in a correct way.

data.name: Line.19.Second.Statement
data.value: Approaching with widespread influence. All is auspicious, and nothing is disadvantageous.

data.name: Line.19.Second.Image
data.value: 'Approaching with influence. All is auspicious.' – (This is so even though the one above) has not yet (fully) complied with (the natural course of) things.

data.name: Line.19.Third.Statement
data.value: Approaching with sweet words (or: complacent oversight). Nothing advantageous. If one becomes anxious about this (and mends one's ways), there will be no blame.

data.name: Line.19.Third.Image
data.value: 'Approaching with sweet words' – (this is because) the position is not appropriate (a weak line on a strong place). 'If one becomes anxious about it' – the blame will not be long-lasting.

data.name: Line.19.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Approaching in the highest sense (or: direct, intimate oversight). No blame.

data.name: Line.19.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Approaching in the highest sense. No blame.' – (Because) the position is appropriate.

data.name: Line.19.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Wise approach (or: overseeing with wisdom). This is fitting for a great prince. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.19.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'This is fitting for a great prince' – (it means) to act in accordance with the Mean (the central path).

data.name: Line.19.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Sincere, magnanimous approach (or: oversight). Good fortune. No blame.

data.name: Line.19.Sixth.Image
data.value: The good fortune of 'sincere, magnanimous approach' – (comes from) the will being directed inward (toward one's own people/country).

data.name: Line.64.First.Statement
data.value: He gets his tail immersed. Humiliation.

data.name: Line.64.First.Image
data.value: 'He gets his tail immersed' – (because) he does not know the proper limit (or: the extreme danger).

data.name: Line.64.Second.Statement
data.value: He drags back his wheel. Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.64.Second.Image
data.value: The second nine's 'perseverance brings good fortune' – (is because) acting from the central position leads to correctness.

data.name: Line.64.Third.Statement
data.value: Before completion. To advance brings misfortune. (Yet) it is favorable to cross the great stream.

data.name: Line.64.Third.Image
data.value: 'Before completion. To advance brings misfortune.' – (Because) the position is not appropriate.

data.name: Line.64.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. Regret vanishes. (With the vigor of) Thunder, he attacks the Gui Fang region. For three years (he fights), and is rewarded by the great country.

data.name: Line.64.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Perseverance brings good fortune. Regret vanishes.' – (For) the will is carried out.

data.name: Line.64.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. No regret. The light of the superior man (shines forth). He possesses sincerity and good faith. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.64.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The light of the superior man' – its brightness brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.64.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He possesses sincerity and (thus can) drink wine. No blame. But if he wets his head (in it), (then) although he possesses sincerity, he loses the proper measure.

data.name: Line.64.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Drinking wine and wetting his head' – (shows) he also does not know moderation.

data.name: Line.21.First.Statement
data.value: Wearing foot-shackles that injure the toes. No blame.

data.name: Line.21.First.Image
data.value: 'Wearing foot-shackles that injure the toes' – (so that) he cannot walk (in wrong paths).

data.name: Line.21.Second.Statement
data.value: Biting through tender skin and injuring the nose. No blame.

data.name: Line.21.Second.Image
data.value: 'Biting through tender skin and injuring the nose' – (because this yielding line) rides on a strong line (the first nine).

data.name: Line.21.Third.Statement
data.value: Biting through dried, tough meat and encountering poison. There is slight humiliation, but no blame.

data.name: Line.21.Third.Image
data.value: 'Encountering poison' – (because) the position is not appropriate.

data.name: Line.21.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Biting through dried gristly meat (with bone). He comes across a metal arrowhead. Perseverance in difficulty is advantageous. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.21.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Perseverance in difficulty is advantageous and leads to good fortune.' – (But the way is) not yet fully illuminated.

data.name: Line.21.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Biting through dried meat. He obtains yellow gold (or: a golden arrowhead). Perseverance (even) in danger. No blame.

data.name: Line.21.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Perseverance in danger brings no blame.' – (Because his) actions are appropriate.

data.name: Line.21.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Wearing a cangue that injures the ears. Misfortune.

data.name: Line.21.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Wearing a cangue that injures the ears' – (because) his hearing (and understanding) was not clear.

data.name: Line.43.First.Statement
data.value: Strong (like one) advancing with the forward foot. To go forward (so rashly) will lead to failure and blame.

data.name: Line.43.First.Image
data.value: 'To go forward without the prospect of success' – this leads to blame.

data.name: Line.43.Second.Statement
data.value: Crying out with alarm and vigilance. Though armed men come at night, have no fear.

data.name: Line.43.Second.Image
data.value: 'Though armed men come, have no fear.' – (Because he) has attained the central path.

data.name: Line.43.Third.Statement
data.value: Strong in the cheekbones (showing anger). There is misfortune. The superior man is resolute in his decision. He walks alone and encounters rain (which wets him). (Though) he is annoyed at being drenched, there will be no blame.

data.name: Line.43.Third.Image
data.value: 'The superior man is resolute in his decision' – in the end, there will be no blame.

data.name: Line.43.Fourth.Statement
data.value: No skin on his buttocks; he walks with difficulty. If he leads the sheep (the strong mass below), regret will vanish. But though he hears these words, he does not believe them.

data.name: Line.43.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He walks with difficulty' – (because) the position is not appropriate (a strong line on a weak place). 'Though he hears these words, he does not believe them' – (for) his hearing (and understanding) is not clear.

data.name: Line.43.Fifth.Statement
data.value: (He is like) the delicate xianlu plant (which is hard to uproot). He is resolute in his decision. Acting from the central position, there will be no blame.

data.name: Line.43.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Acting from the central position brings no blame' – (but) the centrality (of his virtue) is not yet brilliantly displayed.

data.name: Line.43.Sixth.Statement
data.value: No cry (is of any avail). In the end, there will be misfortune.

data.name: Line.43.Sixth.Image
data.value: The misfortune of 'no cry (availing)' – (means this state of affairs) cannot last long in the end.

data.name: Line.44.First.Statement
data.value: Tied to a metal brake-block. Perseverance brings good fortune. To go forward (actively) leads to misfortune. (Like) a lean pig that is sure to keep jumping and frisking about.

data.name: Line.44.First.Image
data.value: 'Tied to a metal brake-block' – (this indicates) the way of the weak (line) is to be restrained.

data.name: Line.44.Second.Statement
data.value: There is a fish in the baul (wrapping). No blame. (But) it is not advantageous for (entertaining) guests.

data.name: Line.44.Second.Image
data.value: 'There is a fish in the baul' – (meaning) in righteousness, it should not extend to guests.

data.name: Line.44.Third.Statement
data.value: No skin on his buttocks; he walks with difficulty. There is peril, but no great blame.

data.name: Line.44.Third.Image
data.value: 'He walks with difficulty' – (but) his movement is not (yet) influenced (by the weak line).

data.name: Line.44.Fourth.Statement
data.value: No fish in the baul. To stir (to action) leads to misfortune.

data.name: Line.44.Fourth.Image
data.value: The misfortune of 'no fish' – (is due to) being distant from the people (the yin element below).

data.name: Line.44.Fifth.Statement
data.value: (He acts) like the willow that overshadows the melon (below). He contains his brilliance within. (Then) something will fall from heaven (to him).

data.name: Line.44.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The fifth nine contains his brilliance' – (because of) his central and correct position. 'Something will fall from heaven' – (for) his will does not neglect the ordinances (of Heaven).

data.name: Line.44.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Encountering with his horn (i.e., in the highest, most remote place). There is humiliation, but no blame.

data.name: Line.44.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Encountering with his horn' – (means) being at the top, one is in an exhausted and humiliating position.

data.name: Line.6.First.Statement
data.value: He does not perpetuate the affair (of contention). There will be a little gossip. In the end, there will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.6.First.Image
data.value: 'He does not perpetuate the affair' – contention should not be prolonged. Although 'there is a little gossip,' the matter will be clearly discerned.

data.name: Line.6.Second.Statement
data.value: He is unequal to the contention. He retires and flees (to avoid it). The people of his city (to the number of) three hundred households (remain undisturbed). There will be no calamity.

data.name: Line.6.Second.Image
data.value: 'He is unequal to the contention; he retires and flees' – (for) from a lower position to contend with one above, calamity comes as if gathered (upon him).

data.name: Line.6.Third.Statement
data.value: He feeds on old virtue (or: lives on his hereditary estate). Perseverance (in contention) brings danger. In the end, there will be good fortune. If he follows the king's service, he will not achieve success.

data.name: Line.6.Third.Image
data.value: 'He feeds on old virtue' – following those above brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.6.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He is unequal to the contention. He returns to (the acknowledgment of) Heaven's ordinance, changes (his attitude), and rests in perseverance. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.6.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He returns to the acknowledgment of Heaven's ordinance, changes and rests in perseverance' – he does not lose (what is proper).

data.name: Line.6.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Contention. (But as the judge,) supremely auspicious.

data.name: Line.6.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Contention. Supremely auspicious.' – (Because he acts) from a central and correct position.

data.name: Line.6.Sixth.Statement
data.value: (Even if) one were (by contention) to receive a leather belt (of office), by the end of the morning it will have been taken away from him three times.

data.name: Line.6.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'To receive robes (of honor) through contention' – (shows one) is likewise not worthy of respect.

data.name: Line.20.First.Statement
data.value: Contemplation like a child. For a common man, no blame. For a superior man, humiliation.

data.name: Line.20.First.Image
data.value: 'The first six contemplates like a child' – this is the way of a common man.

data.name: Line.20.Second.Statement
data.value: Peeping contemplation. Advantageous for the perseverance of a woman.

data.name: Line.20.Second.Image
data.value: 'Peeping contemplation advantageous for a woman' – (but for a man) it is also shameful.

data.name: Line.20.Third.Statement
data.value: Contemplating my own life (or: course). (I consider) advance and retreat.

data.name: Line.20.Third.Image
data.value: 'Contemplating my own course, considering advance and retreat' – (he) does not miss the right way.

data.name: Line.20.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Contemplating the glory of the kingdom. It is advantageous to be a guest of the king.

data.name: Line.20.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Contemplating the glory of the kingdom' – (he is one) who honors (and is fit to be) a guest.

data.name: Line.20.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Contemplating my own life (or: people). For a superior man, no blame.

data.name: Line.20.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Contemplating my own life' – (means) contemplating the people.

data.name: Line.20.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Contemplating his life (or: people). For a superior man, no blame.

data.name: Line.20.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Contemplating his life' – (shows that) his mind is not yet at ease.

data.name: Line.36.First.Statement
data.value: The light is darkened as (a bird) in flight, (so that) it droops its wings. When the superior man (so) leaves (his place), for three days he eats nothing. Wherever he goes, the people there speak (ill of him).

data.name: Line.36.First.Image
data.value: 'When the superior man leaves, for three days he eats nothing' – in righteousness, he does not eat (the bread of the wicked).

data.name: Line.36.Second.Statement
data.value: The light is darkened, (as if) wounded in the left thigh. (But) one uses (the strength of) a strong horse to save himself. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.36.Second.Image
data.value: The good fortune of the second six – (comes from) docility in accordance with rule.

data.name: Line.36.Third.Statement
data.value: The light is darkened, (as in) the case of hunting in the south (where the light is brightest) and taking the great chief (of darkness). (But) one must not be over-eager in his correctness.

data.name: Line.36.Third.Image
data.value: 'The aim in hunting in the south' – is to achieve something great.

data.name: Line.36.Fourth.Statement
data.value: (He penetrates) into the left side of the belly (of the dark land). He gets at the very heart of the darkening of the light, and is able to leave the gate and courtyard (of the lord of darkness).

data.name: Line.36.Fourth.Image
data.value: '(He penetrates) into the left side of the belly' – (and thus) gets at the (true) mind and thoughts (of the situation).

data.name: Line.36.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The darkening of the light as with Jizi. It is advantageous to maintain firm correctness.

data.name: Line.36.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The firm correctness of Jizi' – shows that the light (of intelligence and virtue) cannot be extinguished.

data.name: Line.36.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Not light but darkness. (He was) at first (like the sun) ascending to heaven; afterwards (he) plunged into the earth.

data.name: Line.36.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'At first ascending to heaven' – (so as to) illuminate all the regions. 'Afterwards plunging into the earth' – (because he) lost the proper rule (of conduct).

data.name: Line.41.First.Statement
data.value: He suspends his own affairs and quickly goes (to help). No blame. But let him consider how to diminish (himself appropriately).

data.name: Line.41.First.Image
data.value: 'He suspends his affairs and quickly goes' – (for) he esteems the harmonizing of wills (above his own affairs).

data.name: Line.41.Second.Statement
data.value: It is advantageous to maintain firm correctness. To advance brings misfortune. (In this case,) he should neither diminish nor increase (anything).

data.name: Line.41.Second.Image
data.value: 'It is advantageous for the second nine to maintain firm correctness' – (for) he makes the central position his aim.

data.name: Line.41.Third.Statement
data.value: When three men walk together, their number is diminished by one. When one man walks alone, he finds a companion.

data.name: Line.41.Third.Image
data.value: 'When one man walks alone' – (but) with three, doubt arises.

data.name: Line.41.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He diminishes his ailment (or fault). He makes it quickly go and there is joy. No blame.

data.name: Line.41.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He diminishes his ailment' – (this) also is a thing to be glad for.

data.name: Line.41.Fifth.Statement
data.value: (If) someone (were to) increase him with (the precious gift of) ten pairs of tortoise shells (whose value could not be resisted), he could not refuse it. There will be supreme good fortune.

data.name: Line.41.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The supreme good fortune of the sixth five' – comes from the blessing of Heaven above.

data.name: Line.41.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He does not diminish (others) but increases them. No blame. Perseverance brings good fortune. Advantage in every movement. (He) gets servants, but not for his own family (but for the public good).

data.name: Line.41.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He does not diminish but increases' – (thus) his great aim is attained.

data.name: Line.40.First.Statement
data.value: No blame.

data.name: Line.40.First.Image
data.value: '(This is) at the border of the strong and the weak. In righteousness, there is no blame.'

data.name: Line.40.Second.Statement
data.value: In the field he catches three foxes and obtains a yellow (golden) arrowhead. Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.40.Second.Image
data.value: 'The good fortune of the second nine through perseverance' – (comes from) attaining the central path.

data.name: Line.40.Third.Statement
data.value: A man carrying a (burden) on his back, and yet riding in a carriage – (such behavior) invites robbers to come. However firm and correct he may (try to) be, there will be cause for regret.

data.name: Line.40.Third.Image
data.value: 'Carrying on the back and yet riding' – is also a thing to be ashamed of. 'He himself invites the robbers' – whom should one blame?

data.name: Line.40.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Deliver yourself from your (great) toe (i.e., from inferior companions). Then friends will come, and you will be trusted.

data.name: Line.40.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Deliver yourself from your toe' – (because the line) is not in its appropriate place.

data.name: Line.40.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Only the superior man can (effect) the deliverance (of the country). There will be good fortune. (He uses his) sincerity towards small men (as well).

data.name: Line.40.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The superior man effects the deliverance' – (and then) small men retire (of themselves).

data.name: Line.40.Sixth.Statement
data.value: A prince (with his bow) shoots a falcon on the top of a high wall. He gets it. Everything is advantageous.

data.name: Line.40.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'The prince shoots the falcon' – thereby removing (the cause of) rebellion.

data.name: Line.53.First.Statement
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the riverbank. For a young man (in such a position), there is peril. There will be criticism. No blame.

data.name: Line.53.First.Image
data.value: 'The peril for the young man' – (yet) in principle, there is no blame.

data.name: Line.53.Second.Statement
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the large, flat rock. (It finds) food and drink, and is at ease and content. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.53.Second.Image
data.value: 'Food and drink, and contentment' – (he does not enjoy his meal) in vain (i.e., he deserves it).

data.name: Line.53.Third.Statement
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the dry, flat land. The husband goes to war and does not return; the wife is pregnant but does not rear the child. There is misfortune. (Yet) it is advantageous to resist invaders.

data.name: Line.53.Third.Image
data.value: 'The husband goes to war and does not return' – (he) is separated from his kind. 'The wife is pregnant but does not rear the child' – (she) has lost the proper way. 'Advantageous to resist invaders' – (for by uniting) they protect each other in obedience (to the situation).

data.name: Line.53.Fourth.Statement
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the trees. It may alight on the flat branches (that can support it). No blame.

data.name: Line.53.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'It may alight on the flat branches' – (by being) docile and adaptable.

data.name: Line.53.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the high hill. (Like) a wife who for three years does not conceive, (but) in the end, nothing can overcome her (constancy). There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.53.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'In the end, nothing can overcome her, (leading to) good fortune' – (for she) attains her desire.

data.name: Line.53.Sixth.Statement
data.value: The wild goose gradually advances to the (high, level) plateau. Its feathers can be used for (the ornaments of) ceremonial rites. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.53.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Its feathers can be used for ceremonial rites, (leading to) good fortune' – (for this order) cannot be disturbed.

data.name: Line.3.First.Statement
data.value: Hesitating and wander (like a stone pillar). Advantageous to abide in perseverance. Advantageous to appoint feudal lords.

data.name: Line.3.First.Image
data.value: 'Though he hesitates and wander' – his will and action are correct. 'In his nobility, he descends to the lowly' – thereby he greatly wins the people.

data.name: Line.3.Second.Statement
data.value: Encircled and hampered, (as if) riding on horses that move in circles. (They are) not robbers, (but come) for marriage. The maiden is chaste and does not consent (to betrothal). After ten years, she then consents.

data.name: Line.3.Second.Image
data.value: 'The difficulty of the second six' – (arises from) riding on the strong (line). 'After ten years she then consents' – (for) things then return to their regular course.

data.name: Line.3.Third.Statement
data.value: (He who) pursues deer without a forester (as guide) only enters into the depths of the forest. The superior man, perceiving the subtle signs (of danger), thinks it better to give up the chase. To go forward will bring regret.

data.name: Line.3.Third.Image
data.value: 'Pursuing deer without a forester' – (shows he) is following (only) the game. 'The superior man gives it up' – to go forward would lead to regret and exhaustion.

data.name: Line.3.Fourth.Statement
data.value: (Like one) riding on horses that move in circles, (yet if he go to) seek marriage, going forward will be fortunate. All will be advantageous.

data.name: Line.3.Fourth.Image
data.value: '(Daring to) seek and go forward' – (shows his) intelligence.

data.name: Line.3.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The difficulty (is like that of one) whose stores of rich nourishment are blocked up. A small (and cautious) perseverance will bring good fortune; a great (and aggressive) perseverance will bring misfortune.

data.name: Line.3.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Stores of rich nourishment are blocked up' – (shows that) the grace (of the ruler) is not yet widely diffused.

data.name: Line.3.Sixth.Statement
data.value: (Like one) riding on horses that move in circles, (and) weeping tears of blood in continuous streams.

data.name: Line.3.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Weeping tears of blood in streams' – how can this state last long?

data.name: Line.59.First.Statement
data.value: He uses a strong horse for his rescue. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.59.First.Image
data.value: The good fortune of the first six – (comes from) docility.

data.name: Line.59.Second.Statement
data.value: Amidst dispersion, he hastens to his resting place. Regret vanishes.

data.name: Line.59.Second.Image
data.value: 'Amidst dispersion, he hastens to his resting place' – (thus) he attains his desire (of security).

data.name: Line.59.Third.Statement
data.value: He dissipates his self (i.e., his personal concerns). There will be no regret.

data.name: Line.59.Third.Image
data.value: 'He dissipates his self' – (for) his aim is directed outward (to the general good).

data.name: Line.59.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He dissipates the crowd (of his party). There will be great good fortune. He dissipates (them, and they gather) like a mound (of earth). This is not what ordinary men can think of.

data.name: Line.59.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He dissipates the crowd, (leading to) great good fortune' – (for his virtue) is great and brilliant.

data.name: Line.59.Fifth.Statement
data.value: His dissolving (influence is felt) like the great perspiration (that flows freely) when he issues his great proclamation. He dissipates (the wealth stored in) the royal palace (for the people's benefit). No blame.

data.name: Line.59.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'No blame in dissipating the royal stores' – (for the king) is in the correct position.

data.name: Line.59.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He dissipates (the fear of) bloodshed, (causing it to) go away and be kept at a distance. No blame.

data.name: Line.59.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He dissipates the fear of bloodshed' – (thus) he keeps harm at a distance.

data.name: Line.32.First.Statement
data.value: If one deepen the duration (too much). There will be evil. No advantage in any movement.

data.name: Line.32.First.Image
data.value: The evil of deepening duration - because he seeks for depth at the beginning.

data.name: Line.32.Second.Statement
data.value: Regret disappears.

data.name: Line.32.Second.Image
data.value: The second nine, 'regret disappears' - because he can maintain his central position.

data.name: Line.32.Third.Statement
data.value: He does not maintain his virtue with constancy. He will incur disgrace. Perseverance will be disadvantageous.

data.name: Line.32.Third.Image
data.value: 'He does not maintain his virtue' - he cannot be contained anywhere.

data.name: Line.32.Fourth.Statement
data.value: In the field there are no game.

data.name: Line.32.Fourth.Image
data.value: Being long in a position that is not his - how can he get game?

data.name: Line.32.Fifth.Statement
data.value: He maintains his virtue with constancy. Perseverance. For a woman, good fortune. For a man, evil.

data.name: Line.32.Fifth.Image
data.value: For a woman perseverance brings good fortune - because she follows one to the end. For a man to make righteousness his rule - following a woman brings evil.

data.name: Line.32.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He shakes his duration. Evil.

data.name: Line.32.Sixth.Image
data.value: Shaking the duration in the highest place - great without merit.

data.name: Line.16.First.Statement
data.value: Boasting of enthusiasm. There will be evil.

data.name: Line.16.First.Image
data.value: 'Boasting of enthusiasm' - his will has reached its limit, and there will be evil.

data.name: Line.16.Second.Statement
data.value: Firm as a rock. He does not complete the day. Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.16.Second.Image
data.value: 'He does not complete the day' - perseverance brings good fortune because he is central and correct.

data.name: Line.16.Third.Statement
data.value: Looking with eyes for enthusiasm. There will be regret. Delay brings regret.

data.name: Line.16.Third.Image
data.value: 'Looking with eyes for enthusiasm' brings regret because his position is not appropriate.

data.name: Line.16.Fourth.Statement
data.value: The source of enthusiasm. He has great possessions. Do not doubt. Friends gather around him as hair clasps gather around the hairpin.

data.name: Line.16.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'The source of enthusiasm' brings great possessions - his will is greatly carried out.

data.name: Line.16.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Persevering in what is sick. He constantly does not die.

data.name: Line.16.Fifth.Image
data.value: The fifth line, 'persevering in what is sick' - because he is mounted on the strong. He constantly does not die - his central position has not perished.

data.name: Line.16.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Dark enthusiasm. Though accomplished, there will be change. No blame.

data.name: Line.16.Sixth.Image
data.value: Dark enthusiasm is in the highest place - how can it be long continued?

data.name: Line.13.First.Statement
data.value: Fellowship with men at the gate. There will be no fault.

data.name: Line.13.First.Image
data.value: 'Fellowship with men at the gate' - going out to associate with others, who can find fault with that?

data.name: Line.13.Second.Statement
data.value: Fellowship with men within his own clan. There will be evil (or disadvantage).

data.name: Line.13.Second.Image
data.value: 'Fellowship with men within his own clan' - this is the path of disadvantage.

data.name: Line.13.Third.Statement
data.value: He hides his arms in the thick grass, and ascends the high hills. For three years he does not show himself.

data.name: Line.13.Third.Image
data.value: 'He hides his arms in the thick grass' - he is opposed by the strong. 'For three years he does not show himself' - he is secure in his position.

data.name: Line.13.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He mounts the wall, but unable to attack. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.13.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He mounts the wall' - but by righteousness he cannot attack. The good fortune is due to his returning to the correct rule.

data.name: Line.13.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Men first weep and lament, but afterwards they laugh. Great armies are victorious, and they meet.

data.name: Line.13.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Men first weep and lament' - because they are central and correct. 'Great armies are victorious, and they meet' - means they overcome one another.

data.name: Line.13.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Fellowship with men in the suburbs. No regret.

data.name: Line.13.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Fellowship with men in the suburbs' - his will has not yet been realized.

data.name: Line.17.First.Statement
data.value: The official receives his badge of office. There will be good fortune. Going out to meet with others brings success.

data.name: Line.17.First.Image
data.value: 'The official receives his badge of office' - because he follows the correct path and obtains recognition.

data.name: Line.17.Second.Statement
data.value: He follows what is tied to him, but loses the stronger man. There will be evil.

data.name: Line.17.Second.Image
data.value: 'He follows what is tied to him' - because he cannot serve both the weak and the strong.

data.name: Line.17.Third.Statement
data.value: Following what is tied to him. To persevere will be evil. To maintain wealth will bring evil, but if one uses correctness in dealing with it, there will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.17.Third.Image
data.value: 'Following what is tied to him' - there is shame in leaving the proper course.

data.name: Line.17.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Following and obtaining. Perseverance will be evil. But if one uses correctness in dealing with it, there will be good fortune. Holding to the brightness of the understanding.

data.name: Line.17.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Following and obtaining' - because his will is set on the brightness of understanding.

data.name: Line.17.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Sincere attachment to excellence. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.17.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Sincere attachment to excellence' - because he holds to the middle course.

data.name: Line.17.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Tied and detained, thus he follows. The king uses him for sacrifice on the western mountain.

data.name: Line.17.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Tied and detained, thus he follows' - because he is at the top and exhausted.

data.name: Line.45.First.Statement
data.value: He meets with his mate. They are both of the same character. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.45.First.Image
data.value: 'He meets with his mate' – (because) corresponding (elements) are moved together.

data.name: Line.45.Second.Statement
data.value: He meets his equal. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.45.Second.Image
data.value: 'He meets his equal' – (because) he is in the central position.

data.name: Line.45.Third.Statement
data.value: He separates himself from his associates. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.45.Third.Image
data.value: 'He separates himself from his associates' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: Line.45.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He separates himself from his associates. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.45.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He separates himself from his associates' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: Line.45.Fifth.Statement
data.value: He rightly obtains the praise (due to him), and in his dwelling-place there is good fortune. He has obtained the (right) position, and is free from anxiety.

data.name: Line.45.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'He rightly obtains the praise (due to him)' – (because) he is in the central position, and is correct.

data.name: Line.45.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage. He puts aside his (ornamental) vessels. He keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them.

data.name: Line.45.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage' – (because) his will is set on what is great.

data.name: Line.22.First.Statement
data.value: He adorns his toes. He leaves his carriage and walks.

data.name: Line.22.First.Image
data.value: 'He adorns his toes' - because the purpose (of his action) is proper.

data.name: Line.22.Second.Statement
data.value: He adorns his beard.

data.name: Line.22.Second.Image
data.value: 'He adorns his beard' - because he follows (the one above) to whom he is attached.

data.name: Line.22.Third.Statement
data.value: Graceful and moist. Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.22.Third.Image
data.value: 'Graceful and moist' - because he is correct (in his position) and obtains what he desires.

data.name: Line.22.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Grace or simplicity? A white horse comes as if on wings. He is not a robber, but will woo at the right time.

data.name: Line.22.Fourth.Image
data.value: The top and bottom lines move in harmony. This is not a case of robbery.

data.name: Line.22.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Grace in the hills and gardens. He rolls his silks. A little humiliation brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.22.Fifth.Image
data.value: The good fortune of the fifth five comes from the joy (in the gifts).

data.name: Line.22.Sixth.Statement
data.value: White grace. No blame.

data.name: Line.22.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'White grace' - because he is at the top, and obtains the place of his desire.

data.name: Line.8.First.Statement
data.value: Have sincerity and be united. No blame. If sincerity is full to the brim, there will at the end be others. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.8.First.Image
data.value: The first six, 'be united' - others coming brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.8.Second.Statement
data.value: Be united from within. Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.8.Second.Image
data.value: 'Be united from within' - you do not lose yourself.

data.name: Line.8.Third.Statement
data.value: Be united with those who are not the right men.

data.name: Line.8.Third.Image
data.value: 'Be united with those who are not the right men' - is this not also hurtful!

data.name: Line.8.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Be united externally. Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.8.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Be united externally with the worthy' - by following those above.

data.name: Line.8.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Manifest union. The king uses three drives to chase, but loses the game before. The people of the city do not warn him. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.8.Fifth.Image
data.value: The good fortune of 'manifest union' - the position is correct and central. He rejects the contrary and takes the compliant, thereby losing the former game.

data.name: Line.8.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Be united without a head. Misfortune.

data.name: Line.8.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Be united without a head' - there is no conclusion.

data.name: Line.42.First.Statement
data.value: It is advantageous to perform great deeds. Supreme good fortune. No blame.

data.name: Line.42.First.Image
data.value: 'It is advantageous to perform great deeds' - because help from below responds to the call.

data.name: Line.42.Second.Statement
data.value: One may increase and be faithful. Eternally persevering brings good fortune. The king uses this to offer sacrifice to God. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.42.Second.Image
data.value: 'One may increase and be faithful' - because the will is set on eternal principles.

data.name: Line.42.Third.Statement
data.value: One increases and is met with sincere confidence. Use this to accomplish virtuous deeds. No blame. If one is truthful, one may use middle men and presents, but has no faith in their loyalty.

data.name: Line.42.Third.Image
data.value: 'One increases and is met with sincere confidence' - because this is a way to express gratitude.

data.name: Line.42.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Follow the middle course and tell your plans to the ruler. He will follow you. Use this to move capital.

data.name: Line.42.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Follow the middle course and tell your plans' - because you act in harmony with those above.

data.name: Line.42.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Be sincere and have true confidence. Do not question. Supreme good fortune. Your sincerity will be blessed.

data.name: Line.42.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Be sincere and have true confidence' - because there is no need to ask about blessings.

data.name: Line.42.Sixth.Statement
data.value: No one adds to his increase. Some strike him. His heart is not constant. Misfortune.

data.name: Line.42.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'No one adds to his increase' - because his position is exhausted and without help.

data.name: Line.31.First.Statement
data.value: The influence shows itself in the big toe.

data.name: Line.31.First.Image
data.value: 'The influence shows itself in the big toe' - his will is directed outward.

data.name: Line.31.Second.Statement
data.value: The influence shows itself in the calves of the legs. There will be evil, but if you abide as in correct position, there will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.31.Second.Image
data.value: 'Though there is evil, yet good fortune comes from abiding in correct position' - because compliance will do no harm.

data.name: Line.31.Third.Statement
data.value: The influence shows itself in the thighs. Holds to what he follows. To go forward will be cause for regret.

data.name: Line.31.Third.Image
data.value: 'The influence shows itself in the thighs, and he holds to what he follows' - he does not remain in his position. His will is set on following others, and what he holds is low.

data.name: Line.31.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. Removal of regret. The influence shows itself in the upper part of the back. Friends come as one thinks of them.

data.name: Line.31.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Perseverance brings good fortune. Removal of regret' - there is no failure of the influence. 'Friends come as one thinks of them' - the influence is not yet brilliant.

data.name: Line.31.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The influence shows itself in the muscles of the jaws and cheeks. No regret.

data.name: Line.31.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The influence shows itself in the jaws and cheeks' - the will is set on what is external.

data.name: Line.31.Sixth.Statement
data.value: The influence shows itself in the jaws, cheeks, and tongue.

data.name: Line.31.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'The influence shows itself in the jaws, cheeks, and tongue' - it shows itself by opening the mouth.

data.name: Line.61.First.Statement
data.value: Being prepared brings good fortune. If there are sincerity and (others) are not yet convinced, there will be peace and stillness.

data.name: Line.61.First.Image
data.value: 'Being prepared brings good fortune' - because his will is not yet affected (by others).

data.name: Line.61.Second.Statement
data.value: The crane cries in the shade. Her young ones respond to her. I have a good goblet, and I will share it with you.

data.name: Line.61.Second.Image
data.value: Her young ones respond to her - because they share the same will.

data.name: Line.61.Third.Statement
data.value: He finds a comrade. He strikes the drum, but then ceases. He weeps, but then sings.

data.name: Line.61.Third.Image
data.value: The position of the third six is not suitable (for striking or weeping).

data.name: Line.61.Fourth.Statement
data.value: The moon nearly full. A team of horses falls. No blame.

data.name: Line.61.Fourth.Image
data.value: The position of the fourth six is not suitable (for the team of horses).

data.name: Line.61.Fifth.Statement
data.value: He possesses sincerity, and is uniting (others). No blame.

data.name: Line.61.Fifth.Image
data.value: The fifth nine possesses sincerity and is uniting others - because his position is correct and central.

data.name: Line.61.Sixth.Statement
data.value: The cock's voice rises to heaven. Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.61.Sixth.Image
data.value: The cock's voice rises to heaven - how can it remain long?

data.name: Line.25.First.Statement
data.value: Innocent action brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.25.First.Image
data.value: 'Innocent action brings good fortune' - because will follows correct path without deviation.

data.name: Line.25.Second.Statement
data.value: If one does not count on the harvest when plowing, nor on the use of the field when cultivating it, it is favorable to undertake something.

data.name: Line.25.Second.Image
data.value: 'If one does not count on the harvest' - because one is not thinking of gain.

data.name: Line.25.Third.Statement
data.value: Following what is not proper brings misfortune. But if one maintains innocence, there will be no blame.

data.name: Line.25.Third.Image
data.value: 'Following what is not proper brings misfortune' - because position is not central and proper.

data.name: Line.25.Fourth.Statement
data.value: One can be innocent. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.25.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'One can be innocent' - because one is in proper position and has support.

data.name: Line.25.Fifth.Statement
data.value: One suffers from innocent illness. No medicine needed. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.25.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'One suffers from innocent illness' - because innocence is maintained despite circumstances.

data.name: Line.25.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Innocent action brings misfortune. No advantage in anything.

data.name: Line.25.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Innocent action brings misfortune' - because one is at the top and exhausted.

data.name: Line.52.First.Statement
data.value: Keeping his toes still. No blame. Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.52.First.Image
data.value: 'Keeping his toes still' - because he stops at the beginning, thus preserving his purity.

data.name: Line.52.Second.Statement
data.value: Keeping his calves still. No blame. Unable to help (those whom he would follow). His heart is not glad.

data.name: Line.52.Second.Image
data.value: 'Keeping his calves still' - because he does not keep his heart (in proper control).

data.name: Line.52.Third.Statement
data.value: Keeping his loins still. There will be suffocation in his breathing. Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.52.Third.Image
data.value: 'Keeping his loins still' - because the urgency (of the situation) is dangerous.

data.name: Line.52.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Keeping his trunk still. No blame.

data.name: Line.52.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Keeping his trunk still' - because he is correct (in his position).

data.name: Line.52.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Keeping his jawbones still. His words are orderly. Perseverance brings good fortune. There will be remorse (at first), but in the end good fortune.

data.name: Line.52.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Keeping his jawbones still' - because he is in the central (position) and correct.

data.name: Line.52.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Keeping still with (benign) sincerity. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.52.Sixth.Image
data.value: The good fortune of 'keeping still with sincerity' - comes from the thickness (of his virtue).

data.name: Line.60.First.Statement
data.value: One goes forth without leaving the gate. Misfortune.

data.name: Line.60.First.Image
data.value: 'One goes forth without leaving the gate' - because one leaves the proper path.

data.name: Line.60.Second.Statement
data.value: One does not leave the gate. Misfortune.

data.name: Line.60.Second.Image
data.value: 'One does not leave the gate' - because one is too rigid.

data.name: Line.60.Third.Statement
data.value: One leaves no gate and has remorse. Misfortune.

data.name: Line.60.Third.Image
data.value: 'One leaves no gate and has remorse' - because one is exhausted.

data.name: Line.60.Fourth.Statement
data.value: One is content with limitation. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.60.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'One is content with limitation' - because one is in correct position.

data.name: Line.60.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Central limitation brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.60.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Central limitation brings good fortune' - because one is central and correct.

data.name: Line.60.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Harsh limitation brings misfortune.

data.name: Line.60.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Harsh limitation brings misfortune' - because one is at the top and without guidance.

data.name: Line.15.First.Statement
data.value: A superior man modest and humbling himself. He may cross the great stream. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.15.First.Image
data.value: 'A superior man modest and humbling himself' - he shows humility to those below.

data.name: Line.15.Second.Statement
data.value: Modesty and harmony. Perseverance brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.15.Second.Image
data.value: 'Modesty and harmony' - because he follows the middle course.

data.name: Line.15.Third.Statement
data.value: Meritorious modesty. The superior man will achieve his purpose. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.15.Third.Image
data.value: The merit comes from his meritorious modesty, showing his ability.

data.name: Line.15.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Nothing that would not be advantageous to modesty. No blame.

data.name: Line.15.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Nothing that would not be advantageous to modesty' - because he does not dare to display his ability.

data.name: Line.15.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Not enriching your neighbor through modesty. Advantageous to attack. Nothing that would not be advantageous.

data.name: Line.15.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Not enriching your neighbor through modesty' - because he applies his humility.

data.name: Line.15.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Modesty that sounds forth. Advantageous to have armies and set cities in motion.

data.name: Line.15.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Modesty that sounds forth' - because his will cannot yet be directed.

data.name: Line.39.First.Statement
data.value: Going forward brings praise, coming back brings disgrace.

data.name: Line.39.First.Image
data.value: 'Going forward brings praise, coming back brings disgrace' - it is right to wait.

data.name: Line.39.Second.Statement
data.value: The royal servant relieves the difficulty with great strength. No blame.

data.name: Line.39.Second.Image
data.value: 'The royal servant relieves the difficulty with great strength' - because he is central and correct.

data.name: Line.39.Third.Statement
data.value: Going forward and returning brings difficulty.

data.name: Line.39.Third.Image
data.value: The difficulty arises from his position not being appropriate for the task.

data.name: Line.39.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Going forward brings union. Coming back brings fame.

data.name: Line.39.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Going forward brings union, coming back brings fame' - because he holds to the right course.

data.name: Line.39.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Great difficulty. Friends come to help.

data.name: Line.39.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Great difficulty, friends come to help' - because he holds to the middle course.

data.name: Line.39.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Going forward brings difficulty. Coming back brings great good fortune. Advantageous to see great men.

data.name: Line.39.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'Going forward brings difficulty, coming back brings great good fortune' - because his course is exhausted. 'Advantageous to see great men' - because his conduct is right.

data.name: Line.38.First.Statement
data.value: Remorse disappears. If you lose your horse, do not pursue it. It will return of its own accord. If you see evil people, guard against blame.

data.name: Line.38.First.Image
data.value: 'If you see evil people' - because you are avoiding their fault.

data.name: Line.38.Second.Statement
data.value: You meet your master in a narrow street. No blame.

data.name: Line.38.Second.Image
data.value: 'You meet your master in a narrow street' - because you have not gone against your proper course.

data.name: Line.38.Third.Statement
data.value: You see your master in a carriage. There is no blame. But you are seized. This is unfortunate.

data.name: Line.38.Third.Image
data.value: 'You see your master in a carriage' - because you are not at peace (with yourself).

data.name: Line.38.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Remorse disappears. You meet your master, though you are separated. There is danger, but no blame.

data.name: Line.38.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'You meet your master, though you are separated' - because your will is set on union.

data.name: Line.38.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Remorse disappears. You eat what was hunted in the pit. What are you doing? The road is difficult.

data.name: Line.38.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'You eat what was hunted in the pit' - because you are not in the proper position.

data.name: Line.38.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Remorse disappears. You see your master dragging a sack. It is not robbery. He is looking for what he has lost.

data.name: Line.38.Sixth.Image
data.value: The dragging of the sack - because he is at the top. He has not yet attained his purpose.

data.name: Line.47.First.Statement
data.value: He meets with his mate. They are both of the same character. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.47.First.Image
data.value: 'He meets with his mate' – (because) corresponding (elements) are moved together.

data.name: Line.47.Second.Statement
data.value: He meets his equal. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.47.Second.Image
data.value: 'He meets his equal' – (because) he is in the central position.

data.name: Line.47.Third.Statement
data.value: He separates himself from his associates. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.47.Third.Image
data.value: 'He separates himself from his associates' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: Line.47.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He separates himself from his associates. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.47.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He separates himself from his associates' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: Line.47.Fifth.Statement
data.value: He rightly obtains the praise (due to him), and in his dwelling-place there is good fortune. He has obtained the (right) position, and is free from anxiety.

data.name: Line.47.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'He rightly obtains the praise (due to him)' – (because) he is in the central position, and is correct.

data.name: Line.47.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage. He puts aside his (ornamental) vessels. He keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them.

data.name: Line.47.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage' – (because) his will is set on what is great.

data.name: Line.11.First.Statement
data.value: He pulls up the grass, coming up with it. Each with his class. Going forward will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.11.First.Image
data.value: 'Pulling up the grass and going forward will be good fortune' - his will is directed outward.

data.name: Line.11.Second.Statement
data.value: He bears with the uncultivated, crosses the Yellow River. He does not neglect those at a distance. His friends are gone, but he gets the middle way.

data.name: Line.11.Second.Image
data.value: 'Bearing with the uncultivated' - he gets the middle way, by which his virtue is made great and bright.

data.name: Line.11.Third.Statement
data.value: No plain not sloping, no going not returning. When difficult, persevere and there will be no blame. Do not worry about your sincerity. In food there will be blessing.

data.name: Line.11.Third.Image
data.value: 'No going not returning' - because this is the border of heaven and earth.

data.name: Line.11.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Fluttering, not wealthy, relying on his neighbors. Not using warning because of sincerity.

data.name: Line.11.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Fluttering, not wealthy' - all lose their substance. 'Not using warning because of sincerity' - the will of the heart is directed to it.

data.name: Line.11.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The emperor gives his sister in marriage. With blessings, great good fortune.

data.name: Line.11.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'With blessings, great good fortune' - because his will is carried out by the middle path.

data.name: Line.11.Sixth.Statement
data.value: The city walls return to moats. Do not use armies. From the city, declare commands. Perseverance will be disadvantageous.

data.name: Line.11.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'The city walls return to moats' - his commands are confused.

data.name: Line.14.First.Statement
data.value: He meets with his mate. They are both of the same character. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.14.First.Image
data.value: 'He meets with his mate' – (because) corresponding (elements) are moved together.

data.name: Line.14.Second.Statement

data.name: Line.14.Second.Image

data.name: Line.14.Third.Statement

data.name: Line.14.Third.Image
data.value: 'He separates himself from his associates' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: Line.14.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He separates himself from his associates. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.14.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He separates himself from his associates' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: Line.14.Fifth.Statement
data.value: He rightly obtains the praise (due to him), and in his dwelling-place there is good fortune. He has obtained the (right) position, and is free from anxiety.

data.name: Line.14.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'He rightly obtains the praise (due to him)' – (because) he is in the central position, and is correct.

data.name: Line.14.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage. He puts aside his (ornamental) vessels. He keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them.

data.name: Line.14.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage' – (because) his will is set on what is great.

data.name: Line.28.First.Statement
data.value: One must spread white rushes beneath the mat. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.28.First.Image
data.value: 'One must spread white rushes beneath the mat' - because he prepares carefully for the great burden.

data.name: Line.28.Second.Statement
data.value: A withered poplar sprouts. An old man gets a young wife. Everything is favorable.

data.name: Line.28.Second.Image
data.value: 'A withered poplar sprouts' - because the old and young are in harmony.

data.name: Line.28.Third.Statement
data.value: The ridge-beam is bent. There will be evil.

data.name: Line.28.Third.Image
data.value: 'The ridge-beam is bent' - because there is no one to help bear the burden.

data.name: Line.28.Fourth.Statement
data.value: The ridge-beam is majestic. Good fortune. There will be great blessing.

data.name: Line.28.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'The ridge-beam is majestic' - because it is strong and cannot be broken.

data.name: Line.28.Fifth.Statement
data.value: A withered poplar puts forth flowers. An old woman gets a husband. No blame, no praise.

data.name: Line.28.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'A withered poplar puts forth flowers' - because this is a weak foundation for bearing fruit.

data.name: Line.28.Sixth.Statement
data.value: One must wade through the water, which reaches the head. Danger, but no blame.

data.name: Line.28.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'One must wade through the water' - because he is exhausted but cannot be harmed.

data.name: Line.46.First.Statement
data.value: He pushes upward with sincerity. Great good fortune.

data.name: Line.46.First.Image
data.value: 'He pushes upward with sincerity' brings great good fortune - his will is in harmony with those above.

data.name: Line.46.Second.Statement
data.value: Sincerity makes it advantageous to use a small sacrifice. No blame.

data.name: Line.46.Second.Image
data.value: The sincerity of the second nine - there will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.46.Third.Statement
data.value: He pushes upward into an empty city.

data.name: Line.46.Third.Image
data.value: 'He pushes upward into an empty city' - there is nothing to cause doubt.

data.name: Line.46.Fourth.Statement
data.value: The king makes an offering on Mount Qi. Good fortune. No blame.

data.name: Line.46.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'The king makes an offering on Mount Qi' - he acts in accordance with the proper ceremony.

data.name: Line.46.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Perseverance brings good fortune. He pushes upward by steps.

data.name: Line.46.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Perseverance brings good fortune, pushing upward by steps' - his will is greatly fulfilled.

data.name: Line.46.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He pushes upward in darkness. It will be advantageous to be persevering and ceaseless.

data.name: Line.46.Sixth.Image
data.value: Pushing upward in darkness at the top - leads to decrease and not to wealth.

data.name: Line.33.First.Statement
data.value: At the commencement of retreat, there is danger. Nothing would be advantageous.

data.name: Line.33.First.Image
data.value: 'At the commencement of retreat, there is danger' – (because) the strong (line) is close (to the weak one).

data.name: Line.33.Second.Statement
data.value: He holds (his purpose) fast as if bound with cords and ropes, and (is placed) in a stock or wooden cage.

data.name: Line.33.Second.Image
data.value: 'He holds (his purpose) fast as if bound' – (because) he is in the central position, and is obedient.

data.name: Line.33.Third.Statement
data.value: He nourishes (his) excellence as with rich food, and (is placed) in a carriage drawn by bronze horses. He is favored by the ruler, who gives him audience.

data.name: Line.33.Third.Image
data.value: 'He nourishes (his) excellence as with rich food' – (because) he is in the central position, and responds to (the ruler above).

data.name: Line.33.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He advances (like a rabbit) and finds no resting-place. To go forward would be dangerous. To remain where he is would be right.

data.name: Line.33.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'To remain where he is would be right' – (because) he cannot be in the central position.

data.name: Line.33.Fifth.Statement
data.value: He rightly obtains the praise (due to him), and in his dwelling-place there is good fortune. He has obtained the (right) position, and is free from anxiety.

data.name: Line.33.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'He rightly obtains the praise (due to him)' – (because) he is in the central position, and is correct.

data.name: Line.33.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He advances (like a bird) and finds no resting-place. To go forward would be dangerous. To remain where he is would be right. There is no peace for the restless.

data.name: Line.33.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'To remain where he is would be right' – (because) he cannot be in the central position.

data.name: Line.24.First.Statement
data.value: Return from a short distance. No need for regret. Great good fortune.

data.name: Line.24.First.Image
data.value: 'Return from a short distance' - by this he cultivates his person.

data.name: Line.24.Second.Statement
data.value: Excellent return. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.24.Second.Image
data.value: The good fortune of 'excellent return' - because he is benevolent to those below.

data.name: Line.24.Third.Statement
data.value: Frequent returns. Danger, but no blame.

data.name: Line.24.Third.Image
data.value: The danger of frequent returns - but there is no blame in righteousness.

data.name: Line.24.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Walking the middle path and returning alone.

data.name: Line.24.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Walking the middle path and returning alone' - by following the way.

data.name: Line.24.Fifth.Statement
data.value: Sincere return. No regret.

data.name: Line.24.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'Sincere return, no regret' - by examining himself with the mean.

data.name: Line.24.Sixth.Statement
data.value: Mistaken return. Misfortune. There will be disaster. If you use armies, you will finally have great defeat. If you are the ruler of the state, misfortune. Even for ten years, you cannot conquer.

data.name: Line.24.Sixth.Image
data.value: The misfortune of 'mistaken return' - is contrary to the way of the ruler.

data.name: Line.49.First.Statement
data.value: One wraps oneself in oxhide. It is advantageous to persevere.

data.name: Line.49.First.Image
data.value: 'One wraps oneself in oxhide' - because the time is not yet ripe for change.

data.name: Line.49.Second.Statement
data.value: One makes revolution on the day of spring. Going forward brings good fortune. No blame.

data.name: Line.49.Second.Image
data.value: 'One makes revolution on the day of spring' - because one acts according to the season.

data.name: Line.49.Third.Statement
data.value: Revolution brings misfortune. Perseverance brings danger. When revolution has been discussed three times, confidence is established.

data.name: Line.49.Third.Image
data.value: 'Revolution brings misfortune' - because one acts recklessly without proper consideration.

data.name: Line.49.Fourth.Statement
data.value: Remorse disappears. Confidence is established. Changing brings good fortune.

data.name: Line.49.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'Remorse disappears' - because one has changed according to proper principles.

data.name: Line.49.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The great man changes like a tiger. But before seizing, he has doubts.

data.name: Line.49.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The great man changes like a tiger' - because his transformation is awe-inspiring.

data.name: Line.49.Sixth.Statement
data.value: The superior man changes like a leopard. Small men change their faces.

data.name: Line.49.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'The superior man changes like a leopard' - because his transformation follows proper principles.

data.name: Line.23.First.Image
data.value: 'He meets with his mate' – (because) corresponding (elements) are moved together.

data.name: Line.23.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage' – (because) his will is set on what is great.

data.name: Line.12.First.Statement
data.value: When ribbon grass is pulled up, the sod comes with it. Each one finds his mates. There will be good fortune in whatever direction movement is made.

data.name: Line.12.First.Image
data.value: 'When ribbon grass is pulled up, the sod comes with it' – (because) corresponding (elements) are moved together.

data.name: Line.12.Second.Statement
data.value: The superior man has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage. He puts aside his (ornamental) vessels. He keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them.

data.name: Line.12.Second.Image
data.value: 'The superior man has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage' – (because) his will is set on what is great.

data.name: Line.12.Third.Statement
data.value: He hides his light, and keeps his person retired and unknown. He maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them. There is no blame.

data.name: Line.12.Third.Image
data.value: 'He hides his light' – (because) his brightness is obscured.

data.name: Line.12.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He wraps (his light) as with sackcloth. He keeps his person retired and unknown. He maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them. There is no blame.

data.name: Line.12.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He wraps (his light) as with sackcloth' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: Line.12.Fifth.Statement
data.value: He rightly obtains the praise (due to him), and in his dwelling-place there is good fortune. He has obtained the (right) position, and is free from anxiety.

data.name: Line.12.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'He rightly obtains the praise (due to him)' – (because) he is in the central position, and is correct.

data.name: Line.12.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage. He puts aside his (ornamental) vessels. He keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them.

data.name: Line.12.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage' – (because) his will is set on what is great.

data.name: Line.29.First.Statement
data.value: One falls into the abyss. Misfortune.

data.name: Line.29.First.Image
data.value: 'One falls into the abyss' - because one loses the proper way.

data.name: Line.29.Second.Statement
data.value: One seeks but obtains only small advantages.

data.name: Line.29.Second.Image
data.value: 'One seeks but obtains only small advantages' - because one is in central position but still in danger.

data.name: Line.29.Third.Statement
data.value: One enters the abyss, both front and back. Danger, but one can use advantage.

data.name: Line.29.Third.Image
data.value: 'One enters the abyss, both front and back' - because one is exhausted but still has some advantage.

data.name: Line.29.Fourth.Statement
data.value: One is filled with a sacrificial vessel of wine and food. Final good fortune.

data.name: Line.29.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'One is filled with a sacrificial vessel' - because one chooses the correct position.

data.name: Line.29.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The abyss is not yet filled. Level and smooth. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.29.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The abyss is not yet filled' - because one is central and correct.

data.name: Line.29.Sixth.Statement
data.value: One is bound with cords and ropes. Misfortune for three years.

data.name: Line.29.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'One is bound with cords and ropes' - because one loses the way and faces calamity.

data.name: Line.7.First.Statement
data.value: The army should set forth in accordance with the rules. If not, there will be misfortune.

data.name: Line.7.First.Image
data.value: 'The army should set forth in accordance with the rules' - because discipline is essential.

data.name: Line.7.Second.Statement
data.value: One is in the midst of the army. Misfortune. No blame.

data.name: Line.7.Second.Image
data.value: 'One is in the midst of the army' - because one has taken central position but still faces danger.

data.name: Line.7.Third.Statement
data.value: One may encounter misfortune in the army. But there will be no blame.

data.name: Line.7.Third.Image
data.value: 'One may encounter misfortune in the army' - because one's position is not ideal.

data.name: Line.7.Fourth.Statement
data.value: One retreats from the army. Good fortune.

data.name: Line.7.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'One retreats from the army' - because one is not attached to position.

data.name: Line.7.Fifth.Statement
data.value: There are wild beasts in the field. Good fortune in hunting.

data.name: Line.7.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'There are wild beasts in the field' - because central position brings advantage.

data.name: Line.7.Sixth.Statement
data.value: The great prince issues commands and establishes states. Small men should not be employed.

data.name: Line.7.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'The great prince issues commands' - because his authority comes from proper position.

data.name: Line.51.First.Statement
data.value: The shock comes - oh, oh! After it, laughing and talking - ha, ha! Good fortune.

data.name: Line.51.First.Image
data.value: 'The shock comes - oh, oh!' - fear leads to blessings. 'After it, laughing and talking - ha, ha!' - there will be rule thereafter.

data.name: Line.51.Second.Statement
data.value: The shock comes with danger. A hundred thousand times you lose your treasures. You climb the nine high hills. Do not pursue them. After seven days you will get them back.

data.name: Line.51.Second.Image
data.value: 'The shock comes with danger' - because he is mounted on the strong.

data.name: Line.51.Third.Statement
data.value: The shock comes, and makes one uneasy. Though the shock moves one, there will be no error.

data.name: Line.51.Third.Image
data.value: 'The shock comes, and makes one uneasy' - his position is not appropriate.

data.name: Line.51.Fourth.Statement
data.value: The shock plunges one in the mud.

data.name: Line.51.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'The shock plunges one in the mud' - his light has not yet been displayed.

data.name: Line.51.Fifth.Statement
data.value: The shock comes, moving to and fro. Though there be danger, there will be no great loss. Something is to be done.

data.name: Line.51.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'The shock comes, moving to and fro' - he walks in perilous paths. His affair is in the center, so there will be no great loss.

data.name: Line.51.Sixth.Statement
data.value: The shock comes, and makes one look about with fear and trembling. Going forward will be unfortunate. If the shock has not attacked oneself, but one's neighbor, there will be no blame. There will be discussion of matrimonial affairs.

data.name: Line.51.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'The shock comes, and makes one look about with fear and trembling' - he has not obtained the middle position. Though the movement be unfortunate, there will be no blame, for he fears his neighbor and gives warning.

data.name: Line.50.First.Statement
data.value: He meets with his mate. They are both of the same character. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.50.First.Image
data.value: 'He meets with his mate' – (because) corresponding (elements) are moved together.

data.name: Line.50.Second.Statement
data.value: He meets his equal. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.50.Second.Image
data.value: 'He meets his equal' – (because) he is in the central position.

data.name: Line.50.Third.Statement
data.value: He separates himself from his associates. There will be no blame.

data.name: Line.50.Third.Image
data.value: 'He separates himself from his associates' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: Line.50.Fourth.Statement
data.value: He separates himself from his associates. There will be good fortune.

data.name: Line.50.Fourth.Image
data.value: 'He separates himself from his associates' – (because) he cannot help (the ruler).

data.name: Line.50.Fifth.Statement
data.value: He rightly obtains the praise (due to him), and in his dwelling-place there is good fortune. He has obtained the (right) position, and is free from anxiety.

data.name: Line.50.Fifth.Image
data.value: 'He rightly obtains the praise (due to him)' – (because) he is in the central position, and is correct.

data.name: Line.50.Sixth.Statement
data.value: He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage. He puts aside his (ornamental) vessels. He keeps his person retired and unknown, but maintains his principles and acts in accordance with them.

data.name: Line.50.Sixth.Image
data.value: 'He has (the happiness of) a (simple) cottage' – (because) his will is set on what is great.
